items.title: Trump announces additional 100 percent tariff on Chinese imports
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump announced an additional 100 percent tariff on China Friday and threatened to cancel a summit with Xi Jinping, reigniting his trade war with Beijing in a row over export curbs on rare earth minerals. FRANCE 24's Fraser Jackson reports.

items.title: Trump threatens tech export limits, new 100% tariff on Chinese imports starting Nov. 1 or sooner
Trump threatens to impose additional 100% tariff on China and scrap Xi talks
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump on Friday threatened to place an additional 100 percent tariff on Chinese imports starting on November 1 or sooner, expressing frustration with new export controls placed on rare earth elements by China. Trump also cast doubt on whether he would meet with Chinese leader Xi Jinping during an upcoming trip to South Korea.
items.content: US President Donald Trump on Friday threatened to place an additional 100 percent tariff on Chinese imports starting on November 1 or sooner, expressing frustration with new export controls placed on rare earth elements by China. Trump also cast doubt on whether he would meet with Chinese leader Xi Jinping during an upcoming trip to South Korea.

items.title: US-China beef escalates—again

Yesterday, President Trump announced a 100% additional tariff on Chinese goods and export restrictions on “all critical software” on Nov. 1—a response to China going gloves off by imposing unprecedentedly…

items.title: Trump announces additional 100% tariff on China starting next month

items.content: President Trump says the U.S. is imposing an additional 100% tariff on imports from China starting Nov. 1. Today's announcement follows heavy losses on the stock market. CBS News MoneyWatch correspondent Kelly O'Grady reports.

items.title: Trump announces extra 100% tariff on Chinese goods starting next month

items.content: President Trump said Friday he will impose an additional 100% tariff on imports from China starting next month — marking a significant escalation in the U.S.-China trade war.

items.title: Trump threatens 100% China tariffs as Beijing restricts rare-earth exports
items.standfirst: President accuses China of ‘very hostile’ moves and says additional tariffs could come on 1 November ‘or sooner’Donald Trump has threatened to impose additional US tariffs of 100% on China from next month, accusing Beijing of “very hostile” moves to restrict exports of rare earths needed for American industry.Wall Street fell sharply after the US president reignited public tensions with the Chinese government, and raised the prospect of another acrimonious trade war between the world’s two largest economies. Continue reading...

items.content: Donald Trump has announced the US will impose an additional 100% tariff on China imports, accusing it of taking an "extraordinarily aggressive position" on trade.

items.title: US stocks close sharply lower after Trump threatens new China tariffs

items.content: Biggest one-day drop in S&P 500 since April brings weeks long rally to a halt

ai_summary: Bitcoin dropped 10% on Friday, with Ethereum, Solana, and XRP also experiencing significant declines.
President Trump announced a 100% tariff on Chinese imports, escalating trade tensions.
The new tariffs are set to begin on November 1 or potentially sooner, according to reports.
China's response to the tariffs and potential export controls is being closely watched.
The crypto market crash saw approximately $7 billion in crypto assets liquidated.

clusters.title: Al Jazeera reporters follow Palestinians’ return to northern Gaza
clusters.neutral_headline: Palestinians Return to Northern Gaza After Ceasefire

items.title: Al Jazeera reporters follow Palestinians’ return to northern Gaza
items.standfirst: Al Jazeera reporters followed Palestinians making their way back to northern Gaza after a ceasefire deal was announced.
items.content: Al Jazeera reporters followed Palestinians making their way back to northern Gaza after a ceasefire deal was announced.

items.title: Thousands of Gazans return home as ceasefire takes effect
items.standfirst: Tens of thousands of Palestinians headed back to the heavily destroyed northern Gaza Strip on Friday as a U.S.-brokered ceasefire came into effect in a deal that raised hopes for ending the Israel-Hamas war. All the remaining hostages were set to be released within days.
items.content: Tens of thousands of Palestinians headed back to the heavily destroyed northern Gaza Strip on Friday as a U.S.-brokered ceasefire came into effect in a deal that raised hopes for ending the Israel-Hamas war. All the remaining hostages were set to be released within days.

items.title: Palestinians search Gaza rubble for loved ones in ceasefire, return home
items.standfirst: Displaced Palestinians return to the ruins of homes, driven by loss, defiance and the will to rebuild.
items.content: Displaced Palestinians return to the ruins of homes, driven by loss, defiance and the will to rebuild.

items.title: Gaza live: Trump expects ceasefire to 'hold' as Palestinians return to ruined homes
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump said he believed the ceasefire that began in Gaza on Friday would "hold" as the Israeli military pulled out of parts of the enclave and tens of thousands of Palestinians headed back to their homes in the heavily destroyed north. The Israeli withdrawal set the clock running on a 72-hour deadline for Hamas to release the remaining hostages held in Gaza. Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.
items.content: US President Donald Trump said he believed the ceasefire that began in Gaza on Friday would "hold" as the Israeli military pulled out of parts of the enclave and tens of thousands of Palestinians headed back to their homes in the heavily destroyed north. The Israeli withdrawal set the clock running on a 72-hour deadline for Hamas to release the remaining hostages held in Gaza. Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.

items.content: Thousands of Gazans returned home after Israeli troops pulled back, as part of President Trump’s peace deal. Hamas is required to release its hostages by Monday. NBC News’ Richard Engel reports.

items.title: ‘It’s complete devastation’: Gazans return home to ruins
items.standfirst: Displaced civilians returned to a landscape of rubble and ruins in Khan Younis as the Gaza ceasefire came into effect. “No signs of life are left,” said one man. “Everything has been wiped out.”
items.content: Displaced civilians returned to a landscape of rubble and ruins in Khan Younis as the Gaza ceasefire came into effect. “No signs of life are left,” said one man. “Everything has been wiped out.”

items.title: Palestinians displaced to southern Gaza begin journey home as ceasefire comes into effect
items.standfirst: Thousands walk north along coastal road after Israel-Hamas agreement puts stop to fighting for first time in six monthsTens of thousands of displaced Palestinians in Gaza have begun to return to the ruins of their homes after the ceasefire rapidly negotiated in recent days between Hamas and Israel came into effect at noon local time on Friday – the first relief from relentless violence that inhabitants of the devastated territory have had since March.Israeli troops withdrew to new agreed-upon positions during Friday morning and Hamas is expected to release the 20 living Israeli hostages it is holding early next week, after which Israel will free 250 Palestinians serving long-term sentences in Israeli prisons, as well as 1,700 others detained during the war. Continue reading...
items.content: Thousands walk north along coastal road after Israel-Hamas agreement puts stop to fighting for first time in six monthsTens of thousands of displaced Palestinians in Gaza have begun to return to the ruins of their homes after the ceasefire rapidly negotiated in recent days between Hamas and Israel came into effect at noon local time on Friday – the first relief from relentless violence that inhabitants of the devastated territory have had since March.Israeli troops withdrew to new agreed-upon positions during Friday morning and Hamas is expected to release the 20 living Israeli hostages it is holding early next week, after which Israel will free 250 Palestinians serving long-term sentences in Israeli prisons, as well as 1,700 others detained during the war. Continue reading...

items.title: Nobel peace prize officials investigate surge in bets for winner
items.standfirst: Bets for Maria Corina Machado spiked on Polymarket gambling site hours before she was awarded prizeNorwegian officials who oversee the Nobel peace prize are investigating suspicious online betting for this year’s winner that suggests a rare leak from the secretive committee that hands out the prize.Online bets for the Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado spiked on the Polymarket gambling site shortly after midnight on Thursday, Norwegian time, according to the information on its website. Continue reading...
items.content: Bets for Maria Corina Machado spiked on Polymarket gambling site hours before she was awarded prizeNorwegian officials who oversee the Nobel peace prize are investigating suspicious online betting for this year’s winner that suggests a rare leak from the secretive committee that hands out the prize.Online bets for the Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado spiked on the Polymarket gambling site shortly after midnight on Thursday, Norwegian time, according to the information on its website. Continue reading...

items.title: Venezuelan politician María Corina Machado wins Nobel peace prize
items.standfirst: Opponent of Maduro regime receives award and praise for keeping ‘flame of democracy burning’The Venezuelan opposition politician María Corina Machado has won the Nobel peace prize for her dogged struggle to rescue the South American country from its fate as “a brutal, authoritarian state”.Machado, 58, a conservative often described as Venezuela’s Iron Lady, has spent the last year living in hiding after her political movement was widely believed to have beaten the country’s president, Nicolás Maduro, in the July 2024 presidential election. Continue reading...
items.content: Opponent of Maduro regime receives award and praise for keeping ‘flame of democracy burning’The Venezuelan opposition politician María Corina Machado has won the Nobel peace prize for her dogged struggle to rescue the South American country from its fate as “a brutal, authoritarian state”.Machado, 58, a conservative often described as Venezuela’s Iron Lady, has spent the last year living in hiding after her political movement was widely believed to have beaten the country’s president, Nicolás Maduro, in the July 2024 presidential election. Continue reading...

items.title: Nobel Peace Prize awarded to Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado

items.content: The Nobel Peace Prize was awarded Friday to Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado, who lives in hiding after attempting to run for the presidency last year against President Nicolás Maduro

items.content: Venezuelan opposition leader and pro-democracy campaigner Maria Corina Machado has won the Nobel Peace Prize.

clusters.title: 'The clock is ticking': Lecornu faces tight deadline to form government
clusters.neutral_headline: Lecornu Faces Tight Deadline to Form Government

items.title: 'The clock is ticking': Lecornu faces tight deadline to form government
items.standfirst: Sebastien Lecornu, who has just been reappointed prime minister, is scrambling to bring together a new cabinet amid heavy political uncertainty. "The question really is: 'who will be a part of this new government?' One thing is for sure, the clock is ticking", FRANCE 24's Oliva Bizot said, adding that Lecornu has only until Sunday evening to form a government and put forward a budget by Monday.
items.content: Sebastien Lecornu, who has just been reappointed prime minister, is scrambling to bring together a new cabinet amid heavy political uncertainty. "The question really is: 'who will be a part of this new government?' One thing is for sure, the clock is ticking", FRANCE 24's Oliva Bizot said, adding that Lecornu has only until Sunday evening to form a government and put forward a budget by Monday.

items.title: President Macron reappoints Lecornu as French PM
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron reappointed Sebastien Lecornu as prime minister on Friday just days after he quit the job, a move that enraged some of the president's fiercest political opponents who pledged to vote out the new government.
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron reappointed Sebastien Lecornu as prime minister on Friday just days after he quit the job, a move that enraged some of the president's fiercest political opponents who pledged to vote out the new government.

items.title: France's reappointed PM Sébastien Lecornu faces immediate budget challenge
items.standfirst: French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu, freshly reappointed late on Friday just days after resigning, faces a race against the clock to deliver a 2026 budget bill by Monday and attempt to sway a fractious parliament, with opponents on the left and the far right already vowing to shoot down his new cabinet.
items.content: French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu, freshly reappointed late on Friday just days after resigning, faces a race against the clock to deliver a 2026 budget bill by Monday and attempt to sway a fractious parliament, with opponents on the left and the far right already vowing to shoot down his new cabinet.

items.title: Macron reappoints Lecornu as French PM after days of turmoil
items.standfirst: Sébastien Lecornu resigned on Monday after 26 days in the job and he said two days later his "mission is over".
items.content: Sébastien Lecornu resigned on Monday after 26 days in the job and he said two days later his "mission is over".

items.title: Macron reappoints Sébastien Lecornu as French prime minister
items.standfirst: Lecornu, who resigned as PM on Monday, is tasked with urgently delivering a budget to parliamentThe French president, Emmanuel Macron, has reappointed his centrist ally Sébastien Lecornu as prime minister – days after Lecornu dramatically resigned and his new government collapsed after only 14 hours.Lecornu said he accepted returning to the role “out of duty” and would do “everything possible to provide France with a budget by the end of the year and to address the daily life issues of our fellow citizens”. Continue reading...
items.content: Lecornu, who resigned as PM on Monday, is tasked with urgently delivering a budget to parliamentThe French president, Emmanuel Macron, has reappointed his centrist ally Sébastien Lecornu as prime minister – days after Lecornu dramatically resigned and his new government collapsed after only 14 hours.Lecornu said he accepted returning to the role “out of duty” and would do “everything possible to provide France with a budget by the end of the year and to address the daily life issues of our fellow citizens”. Continue reading...

items.title: Macron puts Lecornu back as France's prime minister just days after he quit
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron has reappointed Sébastien Lecornu as prime minister, just days after his resignation, asking him to try again to form a government and produce a budget.
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron has reappointed Sébastien Lecornu as prime minister, just days after his resignation, asking him to try again to form a government and produce a budget.(Image credit: Michel Euler)

items.title: 'I accept out of duty': Macron asks outgoing PM Lecornu to try again to form government
items.standfirst: Just four days after resigning from the role, Sébastien Lecornu was reappointed as prime minister on Friday by French President Emmanuel Macron. The outgoing and now incoming premier will have to try and find, once again, a way out of France's worst political crisis in decades.
items.content: Just four days after resigning from the role, Sébastien Lecornu was reappointed as prime minister on Friday by French President Emmanuel Macron. The outgoing and now incoming premier will have to try and find, once again, a way out of France's worst political crisis in decades.

items.title: Macron reappoints Lecornu as prime minister - four days after he quit
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron has reappointed Sebastien Lecornu as prime minister.
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron has reappointed Sebastien Lecornu as prime minister.

items.title: Macron reappoints outgoing premier Sébastien Lecornu as French prime minister

ai_summary: Sebastien Lecornu was reappointed French Prime Minister after resigning.
Lecornu has until Sunday evening to form a government.
He must present a budget by Monday, facing opposition.
The previous government collapsed after only 14 hours.
Lecornu accepted the role out of duty, aiming to address issues.
